intro: Muscarella stumpflei, commonly known as the Stumpf's muscari, is a unique plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure and clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, violet-colored blooms that appear in late winter to early spring. Muscarella stumpflei is well-suited for rock gardens or containers due to its compact size and ornamental value. It requires well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
